Title: Healthy cookies
Author: Felicity
Intro: I bring to you, the greatest healthy(ish) cookie that you will ever feast your eyes (and taste buds) on in your whole life.
Body:
Now, you may feel like this is an exaggeration however if, like me, you have tried multiple recipes in the past claiming to be made with healthier ingredients that will hit the spot just like a classic choc chip will do, only to be hugely disappointed by the mound of dry almond meal with hardly any flavour claiming to be said cookie, then this is your cookie.

Determination struck and I created the following recipe on a whim one day by pulling all of my baking knowledge combined with some great ingredients from my mum’s well stocked family pantry (thanks mum).
The result is a soft cookie that is buttery sans the butter, sweet minus the regular sugar and keeps fantastically well in the fridge for a few days. 
You can mix in whatever you feel like or have on hand. 
My preference is to go with something crunchy - toasted pecans, something melty - dark chocolate and something chewy - dried apricots.
Method: Pre-heat oven to 160°C Fan Bake. Line two large baking sheets with baking paper and set aside.
Mix together eggs, vanilla, coconut oil and coconut sugar together in a large bowl until well combined.
Add in dry ingredients and mix.
Scoop onto the lined trays, flatten slightly and bake for 12-14 minutes
Let them cool on the trays for 5 minutes before moving to a cooling rack.

Comments.Comment: Thanks for the recipe. It's great to have a healthier option.
Comments.Name: Adam Apple
